title: National Walkability Index
description: EPA developed three data products(Smart Location Database, Access to Jobs and Workers Via Transit Tool, and National Walkability Index) that consistently measure the built environment and transit accessibility of neighborhoods across metropolitan regions and the United States. Users can download data, browse the data in interactive maps, or access the data through web services. The National Walkability Index includes dataset of walkability scores for all block groups as well as the underlying attributes that are used to rank the block groups.
creator: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Sustainable Communities
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
subject: Neighborhood and Built Environment
methods_variables: D2B_E8MIXA - 8-tier employment entropy (denominator set to the static 8 employment types in the CBG)
D4A - Distance from the population-weighted centroid to the nearest transit stop (meters)
D3B - Street intersection density (weighted, auto-oriented intersections eliminated)
D2A_Ranked - Quantile ranked order (1-20) of [D2a_EpHHm] from lowest to highest
D2B_Ranked - Quantile ranked order (1-20) of [D2b_E8MixA] from lowest to highest
D3B_Ranked - Quantile ranked order (1-20) of [D3b] from lowest to highest
D4A_Ranked - Quantile ranked order (1,13-20) of [D4a] from lowest to highest
data_variables: Workers - Count of workers in CBG (home location), 2017
